trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Zoho Mail | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Zoho Mail | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Zoho Mail with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Zoho Mail with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Zoho Mail.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Zoho Mail.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Zoho Mail tenant
trans-unit.target: A Zoho Mail tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Zoho Mail will be able to single sign into the application at your Zoho Mail company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Zoho Mail will be able to single sign into the application at your Zoho Mail company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Zoho Mail
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Zoho Mail

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Zoho Mail.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Zoho Mail.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Zoho Mail.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Zoho Mail.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Zoho Mail, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Zoho Mail, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Zoho Mail</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Zoho Mail</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Zoho Mail with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Zoho Mail with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Zoho Mail application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Zoho Mail application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Zoho Mail page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Zoho Mail page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Zoho Mail Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "http://company.ZohoMail.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Zoho Mail Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "http://company.ZohoMail.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Zoho Mail page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Zoho Mail page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Zoho Mail company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Zoho Mail company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to the Control panel.
trans-unit.target: Go to the Control panel.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Control Panel</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Control Panel</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the SAML Authentication tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the SAML Authentication tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Authentication</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Authentication</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SAML Authentication Details section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the SAML Authentication Details section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Authentication Details</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Authentication Details</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Zoho Mail dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Zoho Mail dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Zoho Mail dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Zoho Mail dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Zoho Mail dialog page, copy the Change Password URL value, and then paste it into the Change Password URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Zoho Mail dialog page, copy the Change Password URL value, and then paste it into the Change Password URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the PublicKey textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the PublicKey textbox.

trans-unit.source: As Algorithm, select RSA.
trans-unit.target: As Algorithm, select RSA.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Zoho Mail, they must be provisioned into Zoho Mail.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Zoho Mail, they must be provisioned into Zoho Mail.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Zoho Mail, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Zoho Mail, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Zoho Mail company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Zoho Mail company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Control Panel \> Mail & Docs.
trans-unit.target: Go to Control Panel \> Mail & Docs.

trans-unit.source: Go to User Details \> Add User.
trans-unit.target: Go to User Details \> Add User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Add users dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Add users dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the First Name, Last Name, Email ID, Password of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the First Name, Last Name, Email ID, Password of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Active Directory account holder will receive an email with a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Active Directory account holder will receive an email with a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Zoho Mail user account creation tools or APIs provided by Zoho Mail to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Zoho Mail user account creation tools or APIs provided by Zoho Mail to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Zoho Mail **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Zoho Mail **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
